title: 4 Killed, 2 Injured In Crash On I-15 In Temecula: Police
description: Two of the deceased were young teens, police said.
content:
The incident occurred around 9:30 p.m., according to California Highway Patrol. The operator of a BMW M4 was driving recklessly while traveling northbound north of Winchester Road and veered left, going over the concrete median will into the southbound lanes, crossing into the slow lane, where it was was struck on the right side by a Nissan Sentra, police said, adding the BMW then went up in flames.

The driver of the BMW, a 25-year-old man from Moreno Valley, was pulled from the driver’s seat by good Samaritans but suffered major injuries and was taken to Inland Valley Medical Center, according to police. His passengers, a 23-year-old woman from Moreno Valley and a boy and girl, ages 14 and 15, both from Moreno Valley, all died at the scene, police said. The Nissan’s driver, a 35-year-old man from Wildomar, died en route to the hospital, and his passenger, a 22-year-old man, was taken to Inland Valley Medical Center in critical condition, according to police.

“Alcohol is not believed to be a contributing factor in this collision,” highway patrol said in a news release. Charges for the BMW driver are pending and witnesses are asked to call police at 951-466-4300, according to authorities.
summary: The incident occurred around 9:30 p.m. on I-15 in Temecula, California, according to the California Highway Patrol. The driver of a BMW M4 was driving recklessly and veered off the median, crossing into the slow lane and being hit by a Nissan Sentra, causing the vehicle to burst into flames. The BMW driver, a 25-year-old man from Moreno Valley, was pulled from the vehicle by good Samaritans but suffered major injuries and was taken to Inland Valley Medical Center with three of his passengers, a 23-woman, a boy and girl, ages 14 and 15, all died at the scene. Police are not believed to have contributed to the accident.
shortSummary: A BMW M4 driving recklessly veered into a concrete median, killing four people and setting alight in Temecula.

argos_summary: At about 9:30 p.m., a BMW M4 driven recklessly north of Winchester Road veered into southbound lanes and collided with a Nissan Sentra, igniting the BMW and causing a fatal crash. The 25‑year‑old BMW driver survived with major injuries, while all four passengers in the BMW and the Nissan driver died; the Nissan passenger was taken to hospital in critical condition. Authorities say alcohol was not a factor, and charges for the BMW driver are pending.
